Diagnosis: Blepharitis Justification: Eyelid swelling and redness; it often occurs chronically but can be precipitated by irritation or recent activity.  7. Diagnosis: Preseptal (periorbital) cellulitis Justification: Swelling and redness of eyelid following activity; usually associated with skin infections, but less likely without systemic signs.  8. Diagnosis: Orbital cellulitis Justification: Serious complication; characterized by eyelid swelling, pain, possibly pain with eye movements, fever—less typical without systemic symptoms.  9. Diagnosis: Herpes simplex virus keratoconjunctivitis Justification: Can cause redness and tearing; often associated with pain and vesicular skin lesions, but less likely here without mention of pain severity or vesicles.  10.
